messages.msgSnippet: This sounds like fun. Norma ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messages.messageBody:
This sounds like fun.
Norma

Molly Mahnke wrote:

> We are getting ready to travel America just like the family in the
> news story.
> We're converting a bus to fit our family of six. Hopefully by winter
> we'll be ready
> to go!!
> Buttons
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Homeschooling in the News 7/4/01
messages.msgSnippet: We are getting ready to travel America just like the family in the news story. We re converting a bus to fit our family of six.  Hopefully by winter we ll be
messages.messageBody:
We are getting ready to travel America just like the family in the news story.
We're converting a bus to fit our family of six. Hopefully by winter we'll be ready
to go!!
Buttons

messages.subject: Homeschooling in the News 7/4/01
messages.msgSnippet: **Homeschooling in the News, from the National Home Education Network** July 4 Asheville Citizen-Times : Family takes trip around the country to educate
messages.messageBody:
**Homeschooling in the News, from the National Home Education Network**

July 4
Asheville Citizen-Times : Family takes trip around the country to educate
children
http://www.citizen-times.com/news/10607985.shtml
One homeschooling family's year-long journey around the United States.

July 2
Seattle Times : Letters to the editor
http://archives.seattletimes.nwsource.com:80/cgi-bin/texis/web/vortex/display?

slug=monlets02&date=20010702
Several letters in response to the op-ed piece the Times printed last week.

Hoosier Times : Home school numbers double
http://www.hoosiertimes.com/stories/2001/07/02/news.010702_HT_A1_DEH09567.sto?

PREVURI=%2Fstories%2F2001%2F07%2F02%2Findex
State figures show the number of area high-school students being home
schooled almost doubling in the past five years from 83 to 163 students.

July 1
Arizona Republic : Home schooling Special Report
The Arizona Republic published the following grouping of articles and
graphics:

Why I like being home-schooled
http://www.azcentral.com:80/news/education/0701homeview.html
Article written by a 15 year old homeschooler.

Home schools: Nobody's watching
http://www.azcentral.com:80/news/education/0701homeschool.html
"Arizona has no way to gauge the quality of home-schooling. Supporters, many
backed by conservative religious organizations, call that freedom; critics
call it irresponsibility."

Home schooling begins at the crack of yawn
http://www.azcentral.com:80/news/education/0701homeside.html
A profile of the Lovera family's homeschooling. This is the family of the
author of the first person article, "Why I like being homeschooled" above.

Other states' home-school laws
http://www.azcentral.com:80/news/education/0701homegraph1.html
Graphic showing the amount of regulation of homeschooling by state.

Number of home-schooled kids, ages 6-18
http://www.azcentral.com:80/news/education/0701homegraph2.html

The Sunday Times (London) : Diary of a Home Educator
I know I'm doing right when an inspector calls
http://www.sunday-times.co.uk/news/pages/sti/2001/07/01/stiednedn01002.html
A homeschool parent's anxiety before the visit of an inspector.

June 29
Time : The ABC's of Home Schooling
http://www.time.com/time/columnist/morse/article/0,9565,165871,00.html
Columnist Jodie Morse attended a homeschool conference in Denver, and emerged
feeling that homeschooling was a possibility for her to consider in the
future.

Minor mentions:

July 4
Inland Empire Online : City hopes everybody joins on general plan
http://www.inlandempireonline.com/news/stories/070101/rplan.shtml

Arizona Republic : Districts take varying paths
http://www.azcentral.com/news/articles/breaking/0704stanford04.html

Seattle Times : Hiker up, walking after waterfall tumble
http://archives.seattletimes.nwsource.com:80/cgi-bin/texis/web/vortex/display?

slug=waterfallsurvivor04m&date=20010704

Washington Post : Md Teen Awaiting Penalty in Bomb Case
http://washingtonpost.com:80/wp-dyn/metro/md/A16019-2001Jul3.html

July 3
USA Today : 'It must be asked: Where was the dad?' Difficult questions haunt
father of drowned children
http://www.usatoday.com:80/usatonline/20010703/3452132s.htm

Courier News : Mother's suit alleges discrimination
http://www.c-n.com/news/c-n/story/0,2111,414826,00.html

July 2
Arizona Republic : Parents' marriage makes teen couple target
http://www.azcentral.com:80/offbeat/articles/0702ThreatenedTeens-ON.html

Honolulu Star-Bulletin : Attendees of vigil hope for rejection of gay
curriculum
http://starbulletin.com:80/2001/07/02/news/story5.html

Washington Post : Struggle Ends for 'Miracle Baby'
http://washingtonpost.com:80/wp-dyn/articles/A4450-2001Jun30.html

Albuquerque Tribune : Acting locally, thinking big
http://www.abqtrib.com/archives/news01/070201_news_terra.shtml

Flint Journal : Behind all festival fun lies hard work of carnie
http://fl.mlive.com/news/index.ssf?/news/stories/20010702f2a3carnies.frm

Odessa American : Odessa boy chosen for 'World' advisory board
http://www.oaoa.com/news/nw070201d.htm

July 1
Milwaukee Journal Sentinel : Church, synagogue schools going forth and
multiplying
http://www.jsonline.com:80/news/ozwash/jul01/schools02070101.asp

Cincinnati Enquirer : 1st class leaves Cyber High
http://enquirer.com/editions/2001/07/01/loc_st_class_leaves.html

Seattle Times : Letourneau was only the start
http://archives.seattletimes.nwsource.com:80/cgi-bin/texis/web/vortex/display?

slug=brodeur01m&date=20010701

Tampa Tribune : Taking a Swing at Cystic Fibrosis
http://www.tampatrib.com/Sports/MGASGJTUKOC.html

in it.

We try to pass along every news article in which homeschooling is mentioned,
without censoring, including negative articles or unfortunate bits written
about or associated with homeschooling. If you are offended by an article,
or if you especially like an article, we encourage you to write the editor
with your comments.
